attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Lagos State Government (LASG) in 2008 enacted the Lagos State Waterways Authority Act, which established the Lagos Waterways Authority (LASWA). LASWA is charged with the responsibility of coordinating and managing the reforms necessary for the long-term growth and development of water transportation in Lagos State, including the granting of ferry licenses and concessions for the operation of terminals to the private sector.

body.value: The Lagos State Government (LASG) in 2008 enacted the Lagos State Waterways Authority Act, which established the Lagos Waterways Authority (LASWA). LASWA is charged with the responsibility of coordinating and managing the reforms necessary for the long-term growth and development of water transportation in Lagos State, including the granting of ferry licenses and concessions for the operation of terminals to the private sector. These reforms entail the creation of an enabling long-term regulatory environment that attracts significant private sector involvement in the provision of water transport services. Through LASWA, the LASG has embarked on policy reforms that promote and facilitate investments for the provision of water transport aimed at realizing potentials towards becoming an attractive mode of transport. The fundamental responsibility of LASWA is to manage, improve and enhance navigation

attributes.content: Charterhouse is one of the UK’s leading independent boarding and day schools, providing an outstanding education for boys and girls aged 13 to 18. The School is set within an inspiring 250‑acre campus, conveniently located close to London and within 50 minutes of both Heathrow and Gatwick airports. With 17 grass sports pitches, 3 full‑sized Astroturf pitches, an athletics stadium, a sports centre, 24 tennis courts and a 9‑hole golf course, not to mention beautiful lawns and gardens, the campus is one of the best, if not the best, in the country.

body.value:
M. A. Al-Kharafi & Sons W.L.L. is a prominent multinational company based in Kuwait, with diverse interests across various sectors including construction, engineering, manufacturing, and agriculture. Established as a family-owned business, the company has grown into a global conglomerate with operations in multiple countries across the Middle East, Africa, and beyond.

M. A. Al-Kharafi & Sons is renowned for its expertise in large-scale construction and infrastructure projects, including roads, bridges, airports, and water treatment facilities. The company is also involved in the development of industrial complexes, power plants, and commercial real estate. With a strong commitment to quality, innovation, and sustainability, M. A. Al-Kharafi & Sons has established itself as a trusted partner for governments and private sector clients alike.

In addition to its core construction and engineering activities, the company has expanded its portfolio to include investments in hospitality, food production, telecommunications, and other industries. M. A. Al-Kharafi & Sons continues to play a significant role in economic development and job creation in the regions where it operates, maintaining a legacy of excellence and social responsibility.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Infrastructural Development Bank of Zimbabwe (IDBZ) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Infrastructure Development Bank of Zimbabwe (IDBZ) was established on August 31, 2005, assuming the assets and liabilities of the former Zimbabwe Development Bank (ZDB). It functions as a key entity aimed at fostering economic development and enhancing the quality of life for Zimbabweans. IDBZ focuses on infrastructure development across various sectors including energy, transport, water and sanitation, information communication technology (ICT), and housing.

body.value: The Infrastructure Development Bank of Zimbabwe (IDBZ) was established on August 31, 2005, assuming the assets and liabilities of the former Zimbabwe Development Bank (ZDB). It functions as a key entity aimed at fostering economic development and enhancing the quality of life for Zimbabweans. IDBZ focuses on infrastructure development across various sectors including energy, transport, water and sanitation, information communication technology (ICT), and housing. According to the IDBZ Act (Chapter 24:14), the bank is mandated to build institutional capacity within infrastructure development enterprises in Zimbabwe. As a specialized infrastructure development finance institution (DFI), IDBZ plays a pivotal role in financing and supporting projects that contribute to national development and economic growth.
body.processed: The Infrastructure Development Bank of Zimbabwe (IDBZ) was established on August 31, 2005, assuming the assets and liabilities of the former Zimbabwe Development Bank (ZDB). It functions as a key entity aimed at fostering economic development and enhancing the quality of life for Zimbabweans. IDBZ focuses on infrastructure development across various sectors including energy, transport, water and sanitation, information communication technology (ICT), and housing. According to the IDBZ Act (Chapter 24:14), the bank is mandated to build institutional capacity within infrastructure development enterprises in Zimbabwe. As a specialized infrastructure development finance institution (DFI), IDBZ plays a pivotal role in financing and supporting projects that contribute to national development and economic growth.

attributes.content: ZF Devco BV, founded in 2022 by Matthew C. VanderBorgh and Jaffer Machano, is a Netherlands-based development company dedicated to advancing Zanzibar's Blue Economy. Their flagship project, the Passenger and RoRo Ferry Terminal near Stone Town, aims to enhance connectivity between Zanzibar and East Africa. Their mission includes setting high standards for safety, efficiency, and environmental stewardship.

attributes.content: Source Energia (Source Capital Group) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Source Energia is a leading renewable energy platform in Lusophone Africa, specializing in the development, finance, construction, and management of both on- and off-grid projects. Leveraging over 70 years of combined experience and deep local expertise, Source Energia adeptly navigates commercial and regulatory landscapes. Source Capital, an advisory and equity boutique founded in 2015, focuses on investment in energy and private equity across Portuguese-speaking Africa, especially in Mozambique and Angola.

body.value: Source Energia is a leading renewable energy platform in Lusophone Africa, specializing in the development, finance, construction, and management of both on- and off-grid projects. Leveraging over 70 years of combined experience and deep local expertise, Source Energia adeptly navigates commercial and regulatory landscapes. Source Capital, an advisory and equity boutique founded in 2015, focuses on investment in energy and private equity across Portuguese-speaking Africa, especially in Mozambique and Angola. Headquartered in Maputo with offices in Johannesburg and Luanda, Source Capital combines energy, real estate, and financial expertise to advise on and co-invest in mid-sized projects, offering seed capital and taking minority equity stakes where feasible.

attributes.content: Benue State, known as the "Food Basket of the Nation," is situated in Nigeria's North-Central region. Established on February 3, 1976, from the former Benue-Plateau State, it is distinguished by its rich cultural and geographical features. The state's diverse landscape includes lush plains, rolling hills, and the Benue River, which has greatly influenced its identity and bolstered its agricultural-based economy.

attributes.content: Toa Corporation, in collaboration with Shimizu Corporation and JFE Engineering, is undertaking a major infrastructure project in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire. Funded by a Japanese ODA loan, the project involves constructing three steel box girder viaducts at key intersections, with a total value of approximately 13 billion yen and a 33-month timeline starting January 2023. This initiative aims to alleviate traffic congestion and improve transportation flow in Abidjan, following Toa's previous work on the Abidjan Port Cereal Berth.

attributes.content: State Department for Fisheries and Blue Economy | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The State Department for Fisheries and Blue Economy in Kenya, operating under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries, and Cooperatives, plays a vital role in managing the country’s fisheries resources and advancing the blue economy. Its responsibilities include regulating marine and freshwater fish resources to ensure sustainability, supporting aquaculture to enhance food security and reduce pressure on wild stocks, and protecting marine ecosystems like coral reefs, mangroves, and seagrass beds.

body.value: The State Department for Fisheries and Blue Economy in Kenya, operating under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries, and Cooperatives, plays a vital role in managing the country’s fisheries resources and advancing the blue economy. Its responsibilities include regulating marine and freshwater fish resources to ensure sustainability, supporting aquaculture to enhance food security and reduce pressure on wild stocks, and protecting marine ecosystems like coral reefs, mangroves, and seagrass beds. The department also develops strategies for the sustainable exploitation of marine resources, supports sectors such as coastal tourism and maritime transport, gathers research data to inform policy, formulates and enforces regulations, engages with local communities to promote sustainable practices, and participates in international efforts to manage marine resources. Effective management of Kenya’s extensive coastline and freshwater resources is crucial for food security, economic development, and ecological health, with the blue economy offering opportunities for growth and resource preservation.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mines is tasked with designing and implementing national policies for energy, geology, and mining; promoting geological research and mining activities; and working with the Ministry of Water, the Environment, Regional Planning, and Town Planning (MEEATU) to develop the National Water Policy and necessary sanitation reforms.

body.value: The Ministry of Energy and Mines is tasked with designing and implementing national policies for energy, geology, and mining; promoting geological research and mining activities; and working with the Ministry of Water, the Environment, Regional Planning, and Town Planning (MEEATU) to develop the National Water Policy and necessary sanitation reforms. It is also responsible for creating an Energy Supply program to ensure sustainable access to modern energy, promoting renewable energies through research and dissemination, and participating in regional and international energy exchange and partnerships. Additionally, the Ministry oversees the planning, construction, and management of hydraulic, energy, and basic sanitation infrastructures, and is involved in developing and monitoring its investment projects.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: EYRC Architects (formerly Ehrlich Architects) is an internationally acclaimed modern residential and commercial architecture firm in southern California. Ehrlich Yanai Rhee Chaney Architects (EYRC), honored with the AIA National Firm Award in 2015, is a renowned architectural practice celebrated for its design excellence and exemplary professional culture.

body.value: EYRC Architects (formerly Ehrlich Architects) is an internationally acclaimed modern residential and commercial architecture firm in southern California. Ehrlich Yanai Rhee Chaney Architects (EYRC), honored with the AIA National Firm Award in 2015, is a renowned architectural practice celebrated for its design excellence and exemplary professional culture. Established in 1979 and based in Los Angeles and San Francisco, the firm comprises a 40-member team skilled in a diverse range of building types, from residential homes to courthouses, libraries, university centers, and corporate and government facilities. EYRC has garnered over 200 awards, including twelve national AIA awards and the title of AIA California Council Firm of the Year in 2003. The firm’s philosophy traces back to founder Steven Ehrlich’s 1970s work and travel in Africa, where he studied vernacular architecture shaped by site, climate, and cultural influences. This ethos is reflected in their Culver City office, a repurposed 1917 dance hall, where a single open-plan studio fosters collaboration and a strong work-life balance. EYRC’s work has been extensively documented, with ten monographs published, including the latest, “Ehrlich Yanai Outside-In: New California Modernism,” released in April 2019.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Pension Scheme Authority (NAPSA) was established in February 2000 under the National Pension Scheme Act No. 40 of 1996 in Zambia. NAPSA was created to ensure income security for retirees, as well as for cases of death and invalidity, offering improved benefits and monthly pensions compared to the repealed ZNPF. As the official custodian and manager of the ZNPF assets, NAPSA oversees the funds contributed to the ZNPF and continues to disburse benefits to qualifying members of the old scheme.

attributes.content: The East African Community (EAC) is a regional intergovernmental organization comprising eight Partner States: Burundi, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Kenya, Rwanda, Somalia, South Sudan, Uganda, and Tanzania. Headquartered in Arusha, Tanzania, the EAC is one of the fastest-growing economic blocs globally. It is dedicated to deepening cooperation among its members across political, economic, and social spheres for mutual benefit.

body.value: The East African Community (EAC) is a regional intergovernmental organization comprising eight Partner States: Burundi, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Kenya, Rwanda, Somalia, South Sudan, Uganda, and Tanzania. Headquartered in Arusha, Tanzania, the EAC is one of the fastest-growing economic blocs globally. It is dedicated to deepening cooperation among its members across political, economic, and social spheres for mutual benefit. The regional integration process is advancing with notable achievements, including the progress of the East African Customs Union, the establishment of the Common Market in 2010, and the implementation of the East African Monetary Union Protocol.

This collaboration was established to improve banking services and bolster Zambia's economic development. attributes.content: For over 70 years, UNICEF has been dedicated to saving children's lives, defending their rights, and helping them reach their full potential. Operating in Angola since 1976, UNICEF works in alignment with the Government of Angola's Development Plan and the Cooperation Program. The primary goal of UNICEF's work in Angola is to support government initiatives to reduce disparities in social indicators among children.UNICEF supports children across Angola through a programmatic agenda developed with key partners and emergency responses.

With its headquarters in Luanda, UNICEF also operates field offices in Bié, Huíla, and Uíge, implementing activities aligned with the 2015-2019 Cooperation Programme.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry in charge of Emergency Management in Rwanda leads and coordinates disaster management and refugee affairs with the vision of building a disaster-resilient nation and effectively managing refugee issues. Its mission involves establishing mechanisms for disaster prevention, mitigation, response, and recovery while promoting disaster awareness and ensuring proactive refugee policies in line with Rwandan laws and international treaties.

body.value: The Ministry in charge of Emergency Management in Rwanda leads and coordinates disaster management and refugee affairs with the vision of building a disaster-resilient nation and effectively managing refugee issues. Its mission involves establishing mechanisms for disaster prevention, mitigation, response, and recovery while promoting disaster awareness and ensuring proactive refugee policies in line with Rwandan laws and international treaties. Core functions include developing national policies and programs for disaster and refugee management, collaborating with stakeholders for effective intervention, overseeing and evaluating program implementation, enhancing public education and institutional training, and mobilizing financial resources through aid coordination and intergovernmental cooperation.

It is tasked with managing public drinking water services in urban and semi-urban areas, focusing on planning, managing, and financing infrastructure for water capture, production, transport, and distribution.

body.value: The Cameroon Water Utilities Corporation (CAMWATER) is a state-owned enterprise overseen by the Minister for Water and Energy and financially monitored by the Ministry of Finance. It is tasked with managing public drinking water services in urban and semi-urban areas, focusing on planning, managing, and financing infrastructure for water capture, production, transport, and distribution. CAMWATER is also responsible for constructing and maintaining water production and storage facilities, ensuring the quality and operation of public water services, and working with operating companies to inform and educate users about water services and sanitation. Additionally, it undertakes commercial, industrial, and financial activities related to its mission to support and promote its objectives.

attributes.content: The Government of Zanzibar envisions itself as a leader in promoting good governance, peace, and security. Its mission is to foster an environment conducive to effective governance and broad stakeholder involvement in decision-making both locally and internationally. The core values of professionalism, teamwork, transparency, innovativeness, excellence, and accountability guide its operations. Established in 2020 under Zanzibar’s 1984 Constitution, the President’s Office, State House Zanzibar (PO-State House) emerged from a restructuring aimed at improving efficiency and oversight.

body.value: The Government of Zanzibar envisions itself as a leader in promoting good governance, peace, and security. Its mission is to foster an environment conducive to effective governance and broad stakeholder involvement in decision-making both locally and internationally. The core values of professionalism, teamwork, transparency, innovativeness, excellence, and accountability guide its operations. Established in 2020 under Zanzibar’s 1984 Constitution, the President’s Office, State House Zanzibar (PO-State House) emerged from a restructuring aimed at improving efficiency and oversight. Its key functions include developing and managing policies, promoting the President’s image, coordinating regional and international relations, overseeing the Government Security Office, and handling archives. The organization is structured into various departments including the Private Office, State House Services, Communication, International Cooperation, Human Resources, Planning and Research, Government Security, Zanzibar Institute of Archives and Records, the Office of Officer In-Charge in Pemba, and the Office of the Revolutionary Council.

Landmark achievements include the Ndakaini Dam (1993), the Nairobi–Mombasa Road (2006), and the Thiba Dam (2022), all noted for exceptional engineering and low maintenance costs. Currently, STRABAG Kenya aims to expand its portfolio beyond dams and the water sector, incorporating the full range of STRABAG’s services. These include geothermal projects, water treatment, sewage plants, and facility services.
